str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Probably from a primary verb eiro; peace; by implication, prosperity.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
Both (of two). Comparative of amphi; both.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular

str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A middle wall, partition wall, barrier. From mesos and toichos; a partition.
A hedge, fence, partition. From phrasso; a fence, or inclosing barrier.
Enmity, hostility, alienation. Feminine of echthros; hostility; by implication, a reason for opposition.
